snippet: Memories of a short but ferocious conflict between Vietnam and China in 1979 permeate the current sour relations between the two Communist countries now at odds over contested waters in the South China Sea.
abstract: Memories of a short but ferocious conflict between Vietnam and China in 1979 permeate current sour relations between the two Communist countries now at odds over contested waters in the South China Sea; memories are strong not only because of horrendous death toll but also because the Chinese pummeled towns and villages as they withdrew, destroying even schools and hospitals.
lead_paragraph: Memories of a short but ferocious conflict between Vietnam and China in 1979 permeate the current sour relations between the two Communist countries now at odds over contested waters in the South China Sea.

headline.main: Shadow of Brutal ’79 War Darkens Vietnam’s View of China Relations
headline.print_headline: Shadow of Brutal ’79 War Darkens Vietnam’s View of China Relations
